full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 467 Filed 11/15/21 Page 103 of 158 103 LBAAMAX3ps Rocchio - Cross exhaustive definition. Q. OK. And when you say "below the age of consent," you haven't defined that. Correct? A. In, in what you're reading to me? Q. You know that the age of consent varies from state to state and country to country, correct? A. Correct. Q. And so when you're talking about "below the age of consent," you're talking about a -- MS. POMERANTZ: Objection, your Honor. THE COURT: Overruled. Overruled. Go ahead. MR. PAGLIUCA: Thank you, your Honor. Q. When you're talking about "below the age of consent," you're talking about whatever the age is in the particular jurisdiction for someone to be able to consent to sexual contact, correct? A. As one example, yes. Q. OK. You also talked about "trauma," which I understand you define as "exposure by either directly experiencing or witnessing serious bodily injury, death, or sexual violation." Is that correct? A. "Sexual violence," I believe. That's the definition in the DSM-V, criterion of trauma. Q. And that's the definition you've been using here today in SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00007282
